content.en: Chemical optimization algorithms: Scientists have developed algorithms to solve complex problems in chemistry, such as finding the global minimum of the Gibbs free energy in a chemical mixture and improving the reliability and robustness of multiphase equilibrium calculations. These algorithms work by reducing the optimization problem to a sequence of steps and locating stationary points of distance functions. They can also be used to calculate phase stability, construct phase diagrams, and solve phase equilibrium problems. By applying these algorithms, researchers are able to make more accurate calculations and improve our understanding of chemical systems.
content.da: Kemiske optimeringsalgoritmer: Forskere har udviklet algoritmer til at løse komplekse problemer inden for kemi, såsom at finde det globale minimum af Gibbs fri energi i en kemisk blanding og forbedre pålideligheden og robustheden af multiphase ligevægtsberegninger. Disse algoritmer fungerer ved at reducere optimeringsproblemet til en række trin og finde stationære punkter for afstandsfunktioner. De kan også bruges til at beregne fasestabilitet, konstruere faseskemaer og løse fase ligevægtsproblemer. Ved at anvende disse algoritmer er forskere i stand til at foretage mere præcise beregninger og forbedre vores forståelse af kemiske systemer.
